title.native: ロマンティック・キラー

description:
Anzu Hoshino is a "non-heroine type" high school girl who pays no attention to fashion or romance and spends every day playing video games. When the wizard Riri suddenly appears, Anzu is forced to participate in the Magical World's project to stop population decline. This romantic comedy depicts what happens when Anzu goes from living a life immersed in her three favorite things — video games, chocolate, and cats — to being surrounded by handsome guys. Anzu is steadfast in her claim that she never wanted to live in a dating simulation game. She meets a handsome guy who is so popular it hurts, a clean-cut and athletic childhood friend, and a beautiful rich young guy who is naive about the outside world. By meeting Anzu, they all begin to change gradually.

(Source: Netflix)

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Disability
tags.description: A work that features one or more characters with a physical, mental, cognitive, or developmental condition that impairs, interferes with, or limits the person's ability to engage in certain tasks or actions.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

title.native: ロマンティック・キラー

node.description: __Arisa Matsuura__ is a Japanese animator, storyboard artist and character designer, who does animation direction.

**Height:** 147 cm

[Profile (Toho Entertainment)](https://www.toho-ent.co.jp/actor/1127) | [Website](https://www.yu-ri-ka.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/yurika_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_YURiKA29_) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yurika_(musician)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/YURiKA_(歌手))

Yurika Kobayashi, mononymously known by the stage name YURiKA, is a Japanese musician from Hasuda, Saitama who is signed to Toho Animation Records.

From an early age, she had dreamed of becoming a musician. She started playing the piano at the age of 3, and she also listened to the music of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/) and its subgroup Minimoni. While in elementary school, she heard the song "Genesis of Aquarion" by [Akino](https://anilist.co/staff/109335/) in a commercial, which led her to become interested in anime music and a desire to perform songs for anime. Her desire to become an anime musician was also influenced by the popularity of the series [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) and [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680/KON/) at the time.

In high school, she tried out for the Animax Anison Grand Prix and other anime-related singing competitions. In 2014, she placed 6th in a televised competition sponsored by Nippon TV and first in an anime music singing competition sponsored by NHK. In 2016, she won an audition sponsored by the media company Toho and signed a contract with label Toho Animation Records.

She made her professional debut in 2017 with the release of her first single "Shiny Ray" on February 22, 2017; the title track is used as the first opening theme to the anime television series [Little Witch Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21858/).

Glauco Marques is a Brazilian voice actor.

A Mexican audio engineer who sometimes works as an ADR Director.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/wesoly57/profilecard/?igsh=MWlxNDVyMzI2MnVpNw==)

Voice actor and dubbing director at Iyuno Poland, TransPerfect Media Poland, Studio Sonica, Studio PRL and Roboto Global.
